name: Garden Gate Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the Garden Gate B&B listed on Frommer's website; and, it is just minutes from Lahaina, Maui which is the area in which we wanted to stay. It is located in a residential area on a hill side across the street from the most magnificient view of the ocean with absolutely fantastic sunsets!
reviews.title: Fantastic Sunsets at the Garden Gate B&B

likes.disliked: — Having to climb stairs with luggage

reviews.text: We stayed in the Lanai Room which was spacious, clean, nicely furnished and with a lanai connecting to the bedroom. The room also provided a small refrigerator, coffee maker, hair dryer and a few toiletries. It has a very homey feel...very comforting after a busy day of sightseeing, surfing or whatever activities you had planned.
reviews.title: My amazing stay at the Garden Gate Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hosts, Jaime and Bill, were extremely nice and very unobtrusive as each room has it's own exterior entrance. A continental breakfast consisting of fresh fruit, juice, pastries, and coffee is provided daily on the lower patio.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Maui! Value, Luxury, Mellow

likes.liked: — Rooms were a great value and very clean.

reviews.text: If you prefer the quieter side of accommodations then this is definitely the place to stay. We enjoyed it immensely! It will be our choice of accommodations when we again visit Maui.
reviews.title: Not A B&B at all, instead a low ranked motel.

likes.liked: — the price payed for the rooms and the free use of the boogie-boards.
likes.disliked: — the dog-feces that where all over the place and the sad sad breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Garden Gate for such a wonderful experience!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

likes.liked: — Location, rooms with a view, & gracious management

reviews.text: Thanks to the Garden Gate my first stay in Maui was unforgettable. Both Bill and Jaime Mosely (the owners and hosts) were extremely friendly and helpful. The environment had a very tropical feel that was perfectly charming and peaceful. A delicious breakfast was served Monday through Friday mornings, including a range of pastries and fruits to cereal and yogurt. I felt extremely comfortable in my room that came with a television, fridge, coffee maker and wet bar. The rooms were more modern than expected and spotlessly clean. The Garden Gate is perfectly located. We were just two blocks from the main road that leads you to the shopping areas in Lahaina and close to the beaches and busier Hotels. I will defintely be back to the and I recommend that you book your Maui vacation with The Garden Gate Bed and Breakfast.
reviews.title: Glorious Getaway at Garden Gate

likes.liked: — The great peacful environment and the helpful hosts
likes.disliked: — I have no complaints at this time....if there would have been a pool I would have never left!!

reviews.title: The most "hip" and "fresh" Bed & Breakfast in Maui.
reviews.text: The most "hip" and "fresh" Bed & Breakfast in Maui. I enjoyed my stay here, the owners were out of town and a new Manager had taken over. I thought the new approach to serving us was not stuffy or corporate, I felt very relaxed, unlike most other bed and brekfasts that would appeal to older and less worldly travelers. My recommendation for this establishment is very strong, and I would advise more urban travelers as well as any other interested tourist. In my opinion I would compare the rooms to the Ritz Carlton. Happy travels!

reviews.title: Off the beaten path
reviews.text: Being from O`ahu, my husband & I were looking to get away for the weekend and thought a bed & breakfast would be great. While we had a little difficulty finding the Garden Gate B&B at first, we finally found it located in a residential, but quiet neighborhood. We arrived early in the morning and were able to leave our luggage in storage while we enjoyed the beaches prior to checking in later that afternoon. We met Bill, one of the owners, and found him to be helpful in terms of where to eat in Lahaina and just general info about the B&B. He also told us that we could just go directly to our room when we came back, making the check-in process extremely easy. Our room was very spacious & clean and included our own lanai. There is an outdoor lounge/bbq area and always seemed to be a fresh supply of apple-bananas for the taking. We found the Garden Gate to be an affordable & quiet alternative to the big resorts on that part of the island. We would stay there again!

reviews.title: Bed and Breakfast---- NO Breakfast
reviews.text: My husband and I recently spent one night at the end of our vacation at the Garden Gate Bed and Breakfast in Lahaina, Maui. It sure surprised us to simply see a sign that no breakfast was served on Saturday or Sunday. No vouchers were provided or any suggestions were given.Nothing was written on their website. It was very cool treatment by the owners. The place was clean and the garden pleasant, but not located all that well in amongst modest homes and some that were trashed. I would not stay here again. We are now calling the place the "Garden Gate Bed and Nuttin'honey"

reviews.title: A Maui Oasis
reviews.text: My wife and I and family have just returned from a wonderful vacation on Maui. Our vacation was much more delightful because of the Garden Gate Bed and Breakfast and our hosts, Bill and Jaime.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bill & Jamie were the perfect host&hostesses. We had a nightmare stay (Gaia Gardens Inn - it's not an Inn - it's a FARM) the night before and were ever so happy that Garden Gate was recommended by the desk clerk working at Orbitz in the Lahaina Cannery Mall.
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted by the view and the accommodations that Garden Gate offered. The room was very welcoming with it's king size bed, sofa, sink, TV and very large bathroom. The bathroom was spacious with two sinks, perfect for his and her toiletries, and a large Jacuzzi tub/shower.
reviews.title: Maui Oasis

reviews.text: We loved the time we spent in Maui and the time we spent at the Garden Gate Bed & Breakfast. It was fun to run around all day and then know we were going back to soothing and tranquil accommodations that also offered a tasty breakfast of coffee, juice, fresh fruit and several danishes/rolls to choose from.
reviews.title: Our Experience Was Excellent
"King Size Mattress" - NOT
reviews.text: We are already planning for our trip back in March of 2008. We just hope that Garden Gate Bed & Breakfast will have room for us.

reviews.title: Feels like home
reviews.text: My fiance and I visited Maui from New York City. We decided to take a break from all of the hostile bloodsuckers and relax in a laid back environment. We didn't care where we stayed as long as it was down to earth, visually attractive, clean and centrally located. I know living in a city you are used to the best, but Maui is Maui....and when you travel on a budget you get what you pay for. Bill & Jaime were very helpful as well as friendly and gave us travel insight. Reading almost everything on their website, gardengatebb.com, I was informed even before I stayed at the bed and breakfast, so we both had a vague idea as to what this lodging had to offer. Breakfast served monday through friday, which includes a continental breakfast of sorts. Juice, coffee, assorted pastries from a local bakery and an assortment of fruits. My fiance & I both loved the breakfast. Bill gave us a few more reminders that I might have skimmed over while reading about the garden gate. Remember travelers, always lock your car when you are parked at a beach close to a busy trafic area, and "Ho`okipa" which is Hawaiian for extend hospitality. And be sure to visit Kaanapali which has world famous snorkeling. Bill & Jaime were extremely hospitible, contrary to mixed reviews on tripadvisor. Aloooha!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from Maui yesterday and I wanted to share with everyone what a nice experience we had at the Garden Gate in Lahaina. We got so much more than we expected. We were lucky enough to get a free upgrade to a King room with an ocean view. Beautiful. You can watch the sunset from the upper decks. WOW The B&B is in a quiet, residential neighborhood - and we loved not being in the middle of the resort areas (if you want this, stay at a large resort in Kaanapali) You do sacrifice not being right on the beach or the water -but we thought it was worth the trade off for the quiet & privacy we wouldn't have had at a larger place.
reviews.title: Garden Gate was great!

likes.disliked: — Didn't serve breakfast on the weekends.

reviews.title: Unbelievable staff, so very friendly
reviews.text: The room was nice, a little dated, but clean and comfortable. Everyone was very friendly & helpful. I also appreciated the free beach chairs, snorkel gear, coolers and games.

The one thing that was a little disappointing (and just odd) was that they did not serve breakfast on Saturday & Sunday. With our activity & flight schedule, this meant we never got to take advantage of breakfast (isn't this part of the appeal of a B&B?)
reviews.title: Garden Gate Delights

likes.liked: — Great comfort and quiet location, best for the price

reviews.text: There is a great little park just down the street on the water. Just a quick walk down hill. We went there and saw some turtles up close and personal. Also, we were able to see whales using the binoculars they provided - from our private lanai.
reviews.title: Horrible experience with Jamie and Bill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend Garden Gate - but would suggest asking for one of the ocean view rooms - WORTH IT!
reviews.title: Vacation in Maui

description: Garden Gate Bed and Breakfast offers elegant and affordable vacation rental accommodations in west Maui, Hawaii. Our accommodations are centrally located one mile from historic Old Lahaina Town and the Kaanapali Beach coastline. We are also located 30 minutes away from Kahului Airport. Our Maui B&B features the Lanai room with a private deck and panoramic ocean views of Molokai, Lanai, and Oahu.
